snippet: The decision about the city’s 220 coffee shops, where marijuana and hashish are openly sold and consumed, comes in spite of a Dutch law meant to reduce drug tourism.
abstract: Amsterdam’s 220 coffee shops, where marijuana and hashish are openly sold and consumed, will remain open in spite of new Dutch law meant to reduce drug tourism; city officials cite fear of revival of black-market trade as one of many reasons.
lead_paragraph: The decision about the city’s 220 coffee shops, where marijuana and hashish are openly sold and consumed, comes in spite of a Dutch law meant to reduce drug tourism.

headline.seo: Amsterdam Mayor Says Coffee Shops Will Remain Open
headline.main: Amsterdam Shops Selling Marijuana to Stay Open
headline.print_headline: Amsterdam Shops Selling Marijuana to Stay Open
